Coming soon: 44 new electric vehicle charging ports in Rochester & Buffalo! Expanding our EV infrastructure across the state will help us reduce greenhouse gas emissions and combat climate change. So far, NY has helped install 2,000 charging ports.

Authorities must review these videos immediately and make arrests and prosecute as appropriate.  Hate cannot and will not be tolerated in New York.  

Here's a message from a Queens boy to the so-called 'proud boys' – ​NY has zero tolerance for your bs. ​https://t.co/xGxIqeZumm

Today we recognize New York's faith groups and clergy, who do so much to alleviate the suffering of the neediest, build communities, and give a sense of meaning and belonging to so many. We thank you for your dedication and service in helping others. #ClergyAppreciationDay

This funding will help provide the critical support needed to help New Yorkers affected by HIV/AIDS live full lives with a safe place to call home.  I will always fight to ensure the most vulnerable among us have access to decent and affordable housing.

Getting a flu shot is the best way to stay healthy as flu season approaches. I encourage all New Yorkers to get vaccinated as soon as possible — contact your local health care provider or pharmacy.
https://t.co/C44VSdV7Mu

The new Hudson Link bus service will take commuters across the Governor Mario M. Cuomo bridge in 31 new state-of-the-art buses with connections to Metro-North stations in Westchester County.

https://t.co/eoPo88jX39

This was the GOP's plan all along. Give billions in tax cuts to the richest Americans and corporations — then slash social programs that the less fortunate rely on. We won't let them get away with it. https://t.co/l4WytJAGOL

All across the state, New York is investing in airports big and small. Today we broke ground on the $24.7 million expansion of Ithaca Tompkins Regional Airport. This expansion will bring more visitors to the Southern Tier and help the upstate economy thrive. https://t.co/hCkEmqxcku
The beautiful new Schenectady Train Station is a smart investment for a city in the midst of a renaissance. https://t.co/pB9egZpJgp

Hate has no place in New York. I am directing the @NYSPolice Hate Crimes Unit to monitor these anti-Semitic incidents as well as all acts of bias and work with local law enforcement to ensure those responsible are held to account.
https://t.co/TzSYMajaJi

Last night I toured the Gateway Tunnel to expose corrosion and damage. These tunnels are over 100 years old and were damaged during Sandy. They urgently need to be replaced. President Trump and the federal gov't needs to stop playing politics & fund their share of the repairs. https://t.co/0jmp7hUq2I
These tunnels are deteriorating and it will be multiple years before anything new can be built. Time is of the essence. https://t.co/zWihIe4sQR

The Hudson River tunnels are in urgent need of repair. The federal government must stop playing politics and fund the Gateway Tunnel project—the nation’s most urgent major infrastructure project. 

Here’s the video I sent President Trump: https://t.co/TH1PVXLdPb
Congrats to @UofR @RITtigers and @SUNYSFLK! https://t.co/qVnoi0DFRo

Discriminating against pregnant people is illegal and we will hold employers who violate the law fully accountable.

Pregnant or breastfeeding in the workplace? Know your rights:
https://t.co/uhIsVMeYwB https://t.co/t2v88UPL1b

For many of us, pets are part of the family, and no one should be forced to abandon them in the event of an evacuation.

This common-sense legislation will bring comfort to pet owners in times of distress. https://t.co/xP2AT5Rn9K

Today is the opening of the new student-designed community playground at P.S. 218 in Brooklyn! This playground is part of the state's Vital Brooklyn initiative that will expand access to green space and outdoor recreation. 
https://t.co/0U0WSX1dj0
Gov. Cuomo Holds Briefing with NYPD and Mayor De Blasio https://t.co/qRO2K1ZSKD
We are New Yorkers. We are smart. We are tough. We are resilient and we will not allow these terrorists to change the way we lead our lives. https://t.co/fA2cmtFfGb

Out of an abundance of caution, I am deploying additional National Guard soldiers and directing State law enforcement to double security at vital transportation assets across New York.

New Yorkers have never succumbed to fear or intimidation, and today will be no different. https://t.co/8XxY7jWYTJ

Today we mourn the loss of a great public servant, our dear friend Drew Zambelli. I've known Drew for more than 35 years. He was more than just an advisor to my father and me — he was part of our family. We send our deepest condolences to his wife Barbara and their children. https://t.co/B6lAYn4EMa

Wet, windy and potentially snowy weather is on the way for the weekend and I have directed state agencies to prepare roads, personnel and supplies for possible hazardous conditions. I urge all New Yorkers to make sure they are prepared.
https://t.co/r53adpZNRd

New York grieves for those who were killed and prays for those who were injured in this heinous anti-Semitic attack in Pittsburgh. As a nation we must stand together and stand against the corrosive and destructive forces of hate in all of its forms. https://t.co/eyBfd11tS7

I am directing that flags be flown at half-staff in honor of the victims of the hate-inspired shootings in Pittsburgh and Kentucky. We mourn for the victims, and I join with all New Yorkers to call for peace and civility and to denounce hate in all its forms.

The events of the past week do not represent who we are as a nation. The hateful rhetoric and violence are ripping at the fabric of America, and it must stop. In this hour of darkness, we must unite and not divide — and we must stand together against the corrosive forces of hate.
Our country must stand together against the corrosive and destructive forces of hate. https://t.co/hth881fGno

Hate crimes have no place in New York and this funding will help those who are targeted due to their ideology, beliefs, or mission to take additional steps to increase the security of their facilities and keep our communities safe. https://t.co/tg2vHRv8hI
We must stand together and stand against the corrosive and destructive forces of hate in all of its forms. https://t.co/13FA9l9khb

We have zero tolerance for discrimination and hate in the State of New York.

Hate is not protected by our law. Not in speech or in action. 

You have my word as Governor that we will stamp out discrimination whenever and wherever it rears its ugly head. https://t.co/13FA9l9khb
There is no place for hate in our state and New York lives by the credo: that the most powerful four-letter word is still love. https://t.co/Z5rc5b5UFX

Very happy to announce that the $79.4 million modernization of the Greater Rochester International Airport is completed on time and on budget! This project will bring new jobs and growth and the Airport will be a beautiful front door to the entire Finger Lakes region. https://t.co/Y05PWi2rVd

It is unconscionable that any company would force someone to choose between job security and the health of herself and her child. In New York, discrimination against those who are pregnant is illegal, and we will hold employers who violate the law fully accountable. https://t.co/BSUV9LBXos

We lost a giant of the transportation planning world this week. Bill Wheeler epitomized what public service is all about – selflessly getting important things done for the people of the state. We will miss him dearly.
https://t.co/ojSxN5mR1Z

Today the NYS Council on Women and Girls hosted a panel to discuss the pay gap affecting Latina women. Latina women earn just 55 cents for every dollar a man earns, and we're fighting to close this gap once and for all. Thanks to all who participated! #LatinaEqualPay

Modern airports are vital to economic growth and the new Syracuse Hancock International Airport will help usher in a bright future for Central New York.
https://t.co/iWn3peKagz

I am disgusted by the discovery of anti-Semitic graffiti at a house of worship in Brooklyn. At a time when the nation is still reeling from the attack at the Tree of Life synagogue in Pittsburgh, New Yorkers stand united with the Jewish community & against hate in all its forms. https://t.co/jrHKhLj46L

I am appalled by this horrific act of vandalism. The African Burial Ground Monument honors the memory of Africans who were enslaved in Manhattan and is a critical to this state's history. New Yorkers stand united against this display of racism and hate. https://t.co/hl4a3Foi0T
To all those who celebrate, New York wishes you a Happy #Diwali https://t.co/5Y4pbDEc1z

Enroll in a plan by December 15 for coverage beginning January 1, 2019. Sign up and get covered at https://t.co/vWYGz8F0fo https://t.co/Mzhmh0jVh7

Once again the nation is shaken by the news of another horrific shooting, this time in Thousand Oaks. 

Thoughts and prayers will not prevent another shooting—but action can. In the upcoming legislative session, New York will take additional steps to keep our communities safe. https://t.co/h11UJGClX4

Some of the survivors of the Thousand Oaks shooting also survived the Las Vegas shooting last year. This is an epidemic.
 
In the upcoming legislative session, New York will take additional steps to keep our communities safe. Congress should follow our lead. #GunControlNow

Joe Lhota has dedicated decades of his life to public service culminating in two tours of duty at the helm of the MTA. He stabilized the subway system, appointed a new leadership structure, and led with a steady hand during some of the agency’s most challenging moments.

This is a shameful assault on American values and a continuation of President Trump’s fear-mongering politics.

In New York, we remember that we are a nation of immigrants and that our diversity is our greatest strength. We stand with the immigrant community. https://t.co/yePs2JwGpu

As we commemorate the 80th anniversary of Kristallnacht, the Night of Broken Glass, we affirm that there is no place for anti-Semitism or hate of any kind here in New York. I stand together with the Jewish community. #NeverForget #NeverAgain

This is a major step forward for offshore wind in New York, taking us closer to our goal of 2,400 Megawatts of offshore wind energy by 2030.
